item.title: Definition of temperature in physicss
item.description: Definition1 2 Let’s assume there is a system with energy $E$. When the number of microstates for $E$ is denoted as $\Omega (E) = \Omega$, then $$ \dfrac{1}{k_{B} T} := \dfrac{d \ln ( \Omega )}{d E } $$ defines the temperature of the system as $T$, where $k_{B}$ is the Boltzmann constant.
